page.title: 01LIFE STYLES
page.content: The area is typical small holding farming as you would expect on the edge of suburbia where the climate is not conducive to good cropping. It is within commuting distance to Aberdeen for those who like to be relieved of city pressures, and unchanged for the local people who do not like the so called better life style enjoyed in a metropolis. The area offers a unique quality of life which can only be appreciated by those who live there. It is suffering from a reduction in population as farming intensifies and, there being no industry of any size which would create employment worthy of mention. The District Council appears to favour tourism in the area and a great effort is being made to attract visitors who at the moment concentrate mainly on the nearby Royal Deeside.
